title: BBC Four
summary: BBC Four  is a British free-to-air television channel owned and operated by the BBC. It was launched on 2 March 2002,[1] with a schedule running from 7:00 pm to 4:00 am, timesharing with CBeebies (which starts at 6:00am).[2] The channel shows a wide variety of programmes including arts, documentaries, music, international film, comedy, original programmes, drama and current affairs.[3] It is required by its licence to air at least 100 hours of new arts and music programmes, 110 hours of new factual programmes and to premiere 20 foreign films each year.[4][5]
